Groups.Group: Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 6
Red Hat Software Collections 1 for RHEL 7

Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk devtoolset-4-dyninst
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: devtoolset-4-dyninst bug fix and enhancement update
Vulnerability.Description:
Updated devtoolset-4-dyninst packages that fix several bugs and add various enhancements are now available for Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.1. Dyninst is an Application Programming Interface (API) that permits the insertion of code into a running program, as well as changing or removing subroutine calls from application programs. Runtime code changes are useful for a variety of uses, including debugging, performance monitoring, and composing applications out of existing packages. The goal of Dyninst is to provide a machine-independent interface to permit the creation of tools and applications that use runtime code patching. The devtoolset-4-dyninst packages provide the Red Hat Developer Toolset version of Dyninst.
The devtoolset-4-dyninst packages have been upgraded to upstream version 9.1.0, which provides a number of bug fixes and enhancements over the previous version. (BZ#1290469)
For detailed changes, see the Red Hat Developer Toolset 4.1 User Guide linked from the References section.
Users of devtoolset-4-dyninst are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs and add these enhancements.
Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
